definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit.
sentences.chinese: 伏特計是用於測量電路中兩點之間電勢差的儀器。

sentences.english: The three-pole switch was originally used to switch a voltmeter guard along with the signal lines.
sentences.chinese: 三刀開關最早用於切換伏特計保護及信號線路。

sentences.english: Select the lowest range of the voltmeter.
sentences.chinese: 選擇伏特計的最低量程。

sentences.english: Then connect the voltmeter to the HI and LO output terminals of the switch card.
sentences.chinese: 然後將伏特計連接到開關卡的HI和LO輸出端子。

sentences.english: The voltmeter is an electrical instrument for measurement of voltage.
sentences.chinese: 伏特計是用來測量電壓的儀表。

sentences.english: Close the channel and measure the voltage with a sensitive voltmeter.
sentences.chinese: 閉合通道，利用一個靈敏的伏特計測量電壓。
